badgePositionDescription: Position the badge within the game page header
badgeSizeDescription: Choose a different size for the badge
clearCacheLabel: Clear the cache to force refresh all ProtonDB badges
expandOnHoverDescription: Minimalist Only. Display badge text on focus
disableSubmitDesc: Hide the submit button that allows contributing reports to ProtonDB
enableLibraryBadgeDesc: Show ProtonDB badge on game pages in your library
enableStoreBadgeDesc: Show ProtonDB badge as overlay on store pages
storeBadgePositionDesc: Position the badge overlay on store pages
helpAboutDesc: ProtonDB Badges displays ProtonDB compatibility ratings directly on your Steam Deck. See at a glance how well games run on Linux/Proton without leaving the Steam interface.
helpTierPlatinum: Runs perfectly out of the box
helpTierBronze: Runs, but often crashes or has issues
helpTierBorked: Does not run or is unplayable
helpTierPending: Has reports but not yet rated
helpTierNoReport: No reports submitted yet - be the first!
helpSettingSizeDesc: Regular (full size), Small (compact), or Minimalist (icon only)
helpSettingPositionDesc: Where the badge appears on game pages
helpSettingSubmitDesc: Hide the button to submit reports to ProtonDB
helpProtonDBDesc: To submit reports from your Steam Deck, you need to register it as a device on ProtonDB. This requires Desktop Mode.
helpStep1: Switch to Desktop Mode (hold Power button â†’ Switch to Desktop)
helpStep2: Open a web browser (Firefox or Chrome)
helpStep3: Go to protondb.com and log in with your Steam account
helpStep4: Click on your profile icon in the top right
helpStep5: Go to 'My Rigs' and click 'Add a Rig'
helpStep6: Select 'Steam Deck' as your device type and save
helpTipContent: After registering your Steam Deck, you can submit reports directly from Game Mode using the Submit button on badges.
helpSubmitDesc: Help the community by sharing your gaming experience! Reports help others know what to expect.
helpSubmitStep1: Play a game for at least 15-30 minutes
helpSubmitStep2: Click the Submit button on the ProtonDB badge
helpSubmitStep3: Fill out the report form on ProtonDB's website
